section_purpose: This section introduces the experimental evaluation of the proposed approach, describing the implementation setup and high-level training configuration used for the comparative study.
key_points: The section begins the performance comparison of the proposed GraSS model against existing competitors in the literature.
Implementation details are provided: the model is built using PyTorch and DGL libraries.
Training configuration is specified: using a single NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPU, a learning rate of 1e-3, and a maximum of 100 epochs. The same GPU is used for inference.
The overall structure for the experimental evaluation is introduced, leading into more detailed subsections (e.g., base solvers, datasets).
dependencies: Section 3 (APPROACH), which details the model, training, and inference procedures being evaluated.
The '4 EXPERIMENTS' subsection titles listed in the table of contents (4.1-4.6), which provide the full experimental details.
reproducibility_notes: Use of PyTorch and DGL libraries for implementation.
Training hardware: a single NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPU.
The same GPU is used for test-time inference.
